thread.title: Woman behind The Moorside reaction reveals abuse from trolls who 'didn't get the joke'
thread.title_full: Woman behind The Moorside reaction reveals abuse from trolls who 'didn't get the joke'

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Woman behind The Moorside reaction reveals abuse from trolls who 'didn't get the joke'
text:
Woman behind The Moorside reaction reveals abuse from trolls who 'didn't get the joke' Jess Wall was behind the camera for the clip which went viral on Facebook this week Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Recreation of scenes from The Moorside emerges on Facebook Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
When Jess Wall and her friends shared a bizarre reaction of The Moorside on Facebook, they didn't expect it to get so much attention. 
After 1.5 million views and counting - and over 13,000 comments - there have been a lot of people having their say after the clip spoofing the BBC drama based on the fake kidnap of Shannon Matthews went viral on the social media site . 
Jess was behind the camera while partner Hollie Farr, her mother Mandy and pal Dave Roberts nailed their impressions of Karen Matthews, her friend Julie and Shannon's stepfather Craig Meehan. The video was filmed by Jess - although she didn't appear on camera (Photo: Facebook) She shared the clip on Facebook (Photo: Facebook) 
Although the reaction to the video as been largely positive with people amused by their playful take on the drama, others trolled her on Facebook - with one even contacting her boss. 
Speaking to Mirror Online, the 26-year-old revealed she has since removed her place of work - who backed her over the row - from social media, and struggled to ignore the backlash initially. Although most comments were positive, some have complained (Photo: Facebook) She insisted they weren't laughing at the case (Photo: Facebook) 
"At first, I was annoyed at the negative comments and replied to them all saying that we didn’t do it to offend anyone," she said. 
“The video was made to laugh at the show, rather than the actual case - I’d never do that, I’m not that kind of person.” 
She admitted she didn't expect it to go viral, and her phone was constantly buzzing as more people started tagging their friends in the post. Jess Wall has responded to the backlash (Photo: Facebook) 
"I never, ever expected it to get so much attention... My phone was going that mad, it froze when I opened Facebook," Jess added. 
"The general response has been crazy - people even asked us to do other scenes." Like us on Facebook
